title: Antiviral activity of sulphated specialized metabolites from sea urchin Clypeaster humilis: in vitro and in silico studies
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,14185-14193
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA01966K, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Fahd M. Abdelkarem, Hamdy K. Assaf, Yaser A. Mostafa, Aldoushy Mahdy, Modather F. Hussein, Samir A. Ross, Nesma M. Mohamed
Chemical analyses of the sea urchin Clypeaster humilis yielded twelve compounds including; a new sulfonic acid derivative (7R) tridec-1-en-7-yl hydrogen sulphate (1), pyridine-3-yl methane sulfonate (2), boldine (12), and nine known compounds (3–11).
